_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE

ChemRex, Inc. is subject to Program I within the RMP due to the volume of toluene
Diisocyanate stored and used within our facility. We utilize a 6,000 gallon bulk storage
tank to store this material. Due to the nature of operations, we have designed the storage
tank and the delivery systems with the utmost care, taking into account the safety, health,
and environmental impacts this material possess.
The storage tank is located within a diked area inside of our building. The diked area has
the capacity to contain the entire volume of the tank. The tank weight is monitored
closely. We have also installed a redundant safety system, which includes a high levels
alarm, high, high level alarm, automatic pump shut off device, overflow system and a
rupture disk and PLC monitoring of tank weights and direct reading indicating scales
near the tank itself.
Thorough operating procedures have been developed and followed for the TDI unloading
procedure and for processes. Only trained operators are allowed to unload TDI into the
storage tank.
The processes which require the TDI are enclosed and monitored via a PLC system. We
do not handle this material outside of the system. Procedures have been established for
working on all of our processes in which hazards exist. In the event that an incident
would occur with this material, we have developed a detailed response plan which
involves members of our response team. This program follows the ILS for emergency
response. Team members have been trained per the OSHA HazWoper requirements.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
ChemRex, Inc.
333 W. 86th Street
Bloomington, MN 55420

SUBSTANCE: Toluene Diisocyanate (mixed isomers)
PRIMARY ACTIVITIES: Manufacturing of Polyurethane sealants, floor coatings,
mastics, and adhesives.
QUANTITY STORED: 6,000 gallons
WORST CASE SCENARIO

The worst case scenario would be complete tank failure. Tank failure would result in the release of 61,08

0 lbs. or 6,000 gallons into the diked area. The duration of the release is 60 minutes based on the low evaporation rate of TDI, building volume, and ventilation rates. However, the diked area will contain entire contents of the tank within the building. Based on EPA provided formulas, dike size, physical characteristics, and building design there will be minimal impact to the environment and community. Our radius is 316 feet. In addition, the material will react with moisture lessening this radius.

RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS

Complaint with OSHA's PSM standard
Complaint with OSHA's HazWoper standard
Redundant Controls
Operating procedures in place and followed
Trained operators and response teamDiked area inside of building

ACCIDENT HISTORY

The facility has not experienced a release outside the facility which impacts the

environment, community, or required Minnesota Duty Officer in the past 5 years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The state has a detailed response program in place which includes notification procedures. The plan has been viewed by the city safety, health, and environmental officer.

FUTURE CHANGES

We have started discussions with the city and supplier about conducting a mock disaster outside using a tanker truck. We anticipate that the local police and fire departments will want to participate.
